intro: Bursa bursa-pastoris var. tenuis, commonly known as the slender bursa, is a variant of the common bursa plant. It is a low-growing, herbaceous annual that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, triangular leaves that are often hairy and have a distinct glandular appearance. Its flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in loose inflorescences, typical of the Polygonaceae family. This variant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environments, including roadsides and fields.
